item.title: Series of potholes both directions endangering life, 28th January
item.description:
From the River shuttle south to Halfway street along Willersley Avenue in both directions are very large potholes that recent bad weather have made deep and wide enough for bike wheels to drop into putting vulnerable road users at risk of serious injury or death. Potholes are so deep they are down into the concrete surface 10 to 15 cm down. Much debris across the road on both directions due to holes worsening on a daily basis. Needs a survey of whole stretch to pick up every one and proper repair of the road to ensure other smaller potholes donâ€™t open up. Recommend an emergency 20mph strictly enforced limit on this high speed, heavily used route until works are completed to ensure no vulnerable road users are KSI.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62, Willersley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mountain of bed bug infested furniture stacked precariously on pavement, 28th January
item.description:
The furniture labeled 'Do not take, has mites!' has been there for 5 days and belongs to tenants at 14 Vicarage Grove. Have spoken to the neighbour. The tipping appears to be the entire content of the house - chairs, tables, bed frames, mattresses. It is stacked precariously and keeps falling and blocking the foot path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vicarage Grove, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracked road, 28th January
item.description:
This issue has previously been attended by contractors, including JB Riney, however the repeated response has been to simply resurface the area with tarmac. As someone working within the engineering industry, I personally attended site during one of these visits and spoke directly with the operatives. I was informed that the underlying cause is a cracked plate beneath the carriageway, which is leading to continual surface failure and significant vibration. This explains why the issue repeatedly returns and why resurfacing alone has not resolved the problem. The road in question is also a number 51 bus route. Buses regularly use this stretch of road to recover lost time and are travelling at speeds in excess of 30 mph over the defect. This is not only causing severe vibration to the property but also presents a clear safety risk to residents, road users, and bus passengers. Heavy vehicles repeatedly passing over a known structural defect at speed is unacceptable. The impact on my parents has been severe. In August last year, following a serious operation, my mother contacted the council to explain that the vibration was so intense she could not sleep in her own bed and was forced to recover on the sofa. The situation has now worsened to the point where the entire house shakes in every room when vehicles pass. This is not normal living conditions and should not be tolerated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62, Wellington Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cross over is all broken up, 28th January
item.description:
The crossover is all broken up due to there being a cracked plat under the tarmac in the center of the road which is causing it to all shake and make the pavement to crack

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62, Wellington Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
